snippet: The gain was the latest sign of resilience in an economy that has been hit by belt-tightening in Washington as the government tries to cut the budget deficit.
abstract: Commerce Dept reports retail sales rose 0.1 percent in April 2013, following 0.5 percent drop in March, pointing to underlying strength in economy and leading forecasters to raise estimates of second-quarter growth.
lead_paragraph: The gain was the latest sign of resilience in an economy that has been hit by belt-tightening in Washington as the government tries to cut the budget deficit.

headline.seo: Retail Sales Edge Up 0.1%, Prompting Higher Growth Forecasts
headline.main: Retail Sales Rise Slightly, Lifting Hope for Rebound
headline.print_headline: Retail Sales Rise Slightly, Lifting Hope For Rebound
